description.narrative: The Project will rehabilitate about 37.5 kilometers (km) of the two-lane paved road bypassing Ganja, Azerbaijan's second largest city. The project road is part of the country's primary east-west highway linking the capital, Baku, to the Georgian border. It will conform to Azerbaijan's standards for a category II road, with a 7.5-meter (m)-wide pavement and 3.75 m shoulders. The Project will contribute to socioeconomic development in Azerbaijan and its cooperation with Georgia through improved road network, increased traffic, and expanded trade through building an efficient, safe, and sustainable road network, linking Azerbaijan domestically and internationally.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: An efficient, safe, and sustainable Ganja bypass road as an integral part of the East-West Highway.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: An efficient, safe, and sustainable Ganja bypass road as an integral part of the East-West Highway.

title.narrative: Increased daily traffic on the Ganja bypass road from about 1,500 vehicles in 2007 to 2,200 vehicles in 2013

description.narrative: An efficient, safe, and sustainable Ganja bypass road as an integral part of the East-West Highway.

title.narrative: Reduced travel time when using Ganja bypass road and not entering Ganja city: from 40 min in 2009 down to 20 min in 2013.

description.narrative: An efficient, safe, and sustainable Ganja bypass road as an integral part of the East-West Highway.

title.narrative: Reduced international roughness index value for the Ganja bypass road from more than 6.0 in 2007 to 2.5 in 2013 after project completion

description.narrative: An efficient, safe, and sustainable Ganja bypass road as an integral part of the East-West Highway.
